question: What is Saturation index?
exp: Langlier saturation index indicates degree of saturation of CaCO3 in water Used in industry to stabilize water. LSI is based on 1) pH of water 2) Total dissolved solids 3) Alkalinity 4) Calcium concentration 5) water temperature - LI positive - it leads to deposition & scaling - LI negative - it leads to corrosion - LI should be kept zero - to avoid corrosion & scaling
opa: Used to assess the Air quality by measuring concentration of pollutants.
opb: Used to assess the water quality by estimating hardness, total dissolved solids, alkalinity and pH.
opc: Used to assess the Soil quality that whether it is good for growing crops.
opd: Used to assess the Milk quality by estimating the bacterial count in it.

question: Recommended minimum amount of Residual chlorine in drinking water is
exp: Free / Residual chlorine act | Chlorine + water | It combines with impurities and Sestroyes them by formation of hypochlorous acid | Which causes 90% of disinfection | After all impurities are destroyed we leave some Extra chlorine in the water | So that water remains safe and clean to drink for next 24 - 48 hrs. | This additional chlorine is known as free or residual chlorine Recommendation free residual chlorine - In drinking water >= 0.5 mg /L (ppm) - In swimming pools >= 1.0 mg / L - For killing cyclops >= 2.0 mg / L Chloroscope is use to estimate free / residual chlorine level - Test used is ohotulidire test

question: What happens to minimum sample size when range of allowable error is doubled?
exp: Sample size = 4 Pq / L2 ( permissible error )Sample size a 1/ (error)2= 1/ (2E)2= 1/4
opd: Sample size does not depend on acceptable error

question: Which of the following option is true about ROC curve?
exp: ROC curve = Recicver. Operator characteristic curve. 1 - No use 2 - fair 3 - Good 4 - Excellent Area under the ROC cure = 1 - if specificity and sensitivity both are 100% ROC curve - it is a method of evaluating the quality / performance of tests.
opa: It is a method of evaluating the quality/performance of tests
opb: It is plotted as test Sensitivity as x-coordinate versus its 1-Specificity (False positive rate FPR) as the y-coordinate
opc: A perfect test has an area under the ROC curve (AUROCC) of >1
opd: A decrease in sensitivity result in decrease in specificity

question: Median Incubation period means:-
exp: Median incubation period - Time taken for 50% of cases to occur. Incubation period - Time interval b/w entry of organism into body till appearance of 1st signs & symptoms. Serial Interval - Time interval b/w primary & secondary case. Generation time - time interval between entry of organism into body till its maximum infectivity. Latent period - Time interval b/w onset of disease till its first detection. It is corresponding term to incubation period for non-communicable diseases.
opa: Time taken for 50% cases to occur
opb: Time between primary case and secondary case
opc: Time between onset of infection and period of maximum infectivity

question: Rejection of True Null Hypothesis is known as:-
exp: Ho true, Rejected - Type I error Ho false , Accepted - Type II error Ho true , accepted - No Error Ho false , rejected - No Error.

question: Human developmental index includes all except:
exp: PQL I ( physical quality of life index) HDI ( human development index) 1) Literacy rate 1) Literacy rate 2) Infant moality rate 2) Income 3) Life expectancy at 1 year of age 3) life expectancy at bih. 4) 0<PQ LI < 100 4) 0< HDI < +1
